intro: Glochidion dodecapterum, commonly known as the twelve-lobed glabrous leaf vine, is a shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, lowland areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
